fields.description:
When the Wiki is a large document and the cursor is out of the view in the textarea, then it is not possible to preview the wiki. ( the size of text area is increased by dragging it )

When you click on preview, it just gets to that position where the cursor is placed. But when you take cursor to somewhere to the top of the textarea where it is visible when clicking, it shows the preview.
fields.summary: Unable to Preview Wiki

fields.description:
The $BITBUCKET_COMMIT variable contains a commit hash that is too short. It should be a string with a length of 40, but it a string with a length of 12.

As a consequence, the Codecov Bash uploader uses a commit hash that does not pass validation and I cannot upload reports.

I also reported this to Codecov Support: https://community.codecov.io/t/uploading-report-fails-with-ci-provider-bitbucket/130
fields.summary: $BITBUCKET_COMMIT is too short

fields.description:
Hi,

Our app builds then deploys to S3 for Elastic Beanstalk.

Quite often we get a couple of merges happening around the same time. This causes the second build to be paused. It would be awesome if they could be queued and then run when the first one completes.

GitLab has something similar, although it can also be set to cancel the first build if a second one appears.

Thanks\\
Joe
fields.summary: Queue pipeline builds per deployment env

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to have a way to favorite a project or repository, and to have a way to see all favorites in a single view. The current method of having "watched" repos display in the My Work view is cumbersome, especially for those of us who work primarily on a team.

It would be very nice to have a star icon in the blue navbar, just like the one in Jira.

There's a request for this to be implemented in Bitbucket Server already: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-11158
fields.summary: Provide ability to favorite repositories and projects

fields.description:
Regarding the Issues page:

_You might want to move to an ajax post for submitting comments at the bottom so the long page does not always need to reload. Same for edits – it would be great to just change the assigned to from a dropdown on the top right and it is just done. No page reloads._
fields.summary: Move to an ajax post for submitting comments - Raised on customer's behalf.

fields.description: It would be nice to have end points on the v2 API for smart commits configuration, such as turning on the _Require issue keys in commit messages_.
fields.summary: Add end points for smart commits

fields.description:
We have had a few issue where the author of a pull request merges the pull request prematurely because they thought that the PR was already approved.

When asked about it they said they saw a green tick icon on the right corner and assumed (without reading) that the PR was approved.

The icon they referred to was the "build succeeded" icon which is deceptively close to the "Approve" button.

So I think the two should be a bit more apart os more cleraly separated.
fields.summary: Approving pull requests could be more clear

fields.description: I'm working on migrating an application that has been using OAuth1 and API v1.0. I've successfully ported all of our calls to OAuth2 and API v2.0, however a user that started on OAuth1 cannot authenticate with the stored credentials against OAuth2. Is there a way to use the token to directly authenticate or request a new token? If not, are there plans to offer a migration path?
fields.summary: Migration path from OAuth1 to OAuth2 credentials

fields.description:
There is error as follow:

{code}
pigtwo@pigtwo-VirtualBox:~/Desktop$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:vwms/lion.git
Cloning into 'lion'...
The authenticity of host 'bitbucket.org (18.205.93.1)' can't be established.
RSA key fingerprint is SHA256:zzXQOXSRBEiUtuE8AikJYKwbHaxvSc0ojez9YXaGp1A.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes
Warning: Permanently added 'bitbucket.org,18.205.93.1' (RSA) to the list of known hosts.
remote: Counting objects: 126924, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (13307/13307), done.
packet_write_wait: Connection to 18.205.93.1 port 22: Broken pipe  
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
fatal: early EOF
fatal: index-pack failed
{code}
fields.summary: cant't clone a repository

fields.description: Upon navigating to the pipelines > deployments page in settings it is blank, and unable to change the deployment variables
fields.summary: Unable to configure deployment variables

fields.description: Icon and link not updating, reviewed with Matthew Watson at Summit, not sure if the issue has been created yet.
fields.summary: Failed Pipeline status not updating in Sourcetree after successful re-run of pipeline

fields.description:
I'd been using Bitbucket v5.1.0 and the pull request UI had a {{Diff}} tab which showed a file tree and a single detail view with the selected file's diff changes. I recently changed to the web version of Bitbucket and that view is gone and now the view is a single page of all files'  diff. Is there a way to have the single file view?

I found the new beta version which has a file tree, but it will just scroll to the next file, so it is not the same behavior. For now, I have to go into each file, then select diff and that shows the single file view, but it's cumbersome.
fields.summary: Single-file view in pull requests

fields.description:
Would be good to be able to pass up parameters such as title and description for pull requests through the URL the same way it is possible for branch source and target:\\
{{new?source=feature&dest=master}}
fields.summary: Ability to pass PR parameters through URL

fields.description:
It happens quite often that Pipeline logs get corrupted and/or incomplete as per attached screenshot.\\
I have failed to identify a direct cause of it.

The big issue is that it does not get fixed by a refresh of the window, nor a a later point
fields.summary: Corrupted pipeline logs

fields.description: It would be a nice to feature to have an API endpoint to allow users to be able to track the team's Audit Log using API 2.0.
fields.summary: Ability to get Team's Audit Log via API
Open tasks anchor breaks upon changing pages

fields.description:
It would be best if we can have an API endpoint to allow users to get a list of their "Users on plan" from their team/individual account.

This will allow users to monitor the list of users they're paying for.
fields.summary: Ability to Get list of Users on plan via API
API Error when Adding Deploy Key

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Access https://id.atlassian.com and set your full name as “山田” or other multi-byte names
# In the repo that the user has access to, create a new PR and mention that user as PR reviewer by entering “山田”

h3. Expected Result:
The user appears in the suggested list

h3. Actual result:
The user doesn't show up

h3. Workaround:
Change the full name to a single-byte one from https://id.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Unable to set user as PR reviewer when multi-byte chars are set in the full name of Atlassian account

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Imagine a repo with branches A, B, and C.
 # Raise a PR from branch A to branch B, call it "A to B".
 # Raise a PR from branch A to branch C, call it "A to C".
 # Edit the second PR as follows:
 ## change the name from "A to C" to "I'm updated"
 ## change the target branch from C to B
 ## change the description to "XXX"
 ## click "Update pull request"
 # The update appears to succeed, in that there's no error message, but:
 ## the PR you edited has not changed at all (the title is still "A to C", and the target branch is still C)
 ## the first PR (which you didn't edit) now has:
 ### the title "I'm updated" (which should be the title of the second PR)
 ### the description "XXX" (which should be the description of the second PR)
fields.summary: Editing PR updates other PR with same target branch

fields.description:
Currently, The v2 repositories permission API requires multiple pages to list out user permission comparing to v1. This is impacting the request time for a user that have lots of users in their team account and the performance to get all the page is affected as well because of the increase in search pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make a v2 https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/<USERNAME>/permissions/repositories call
# It will not list out all permission in it
# Compare it with v1 https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/privileges/<USENAME>

h3. Expected Results
The output should be all of the user permissions in single a single page

h3. Actual Results
The output is showing half of the user permission and has to be requested for multiple pages which affect request time.
fields.summary: The v2 repositories permission API requires multiple page to list out user permission
Create Webhook API response changed

fields.description: Most languages such as JS, Python or Java have custom repository avatars. Rust just uses the default {{</>}} avatar. I'm not sure this is the right place to post this but it'd be nice if Rust also had a custom avatar.
fields.summary: No repository avatar for Rust

fields.description:
The results page actually displays the proper "assignee" in quotes, so it resolves it properly, but the list shows 0 issues.

E.g. https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?responsible=awbb

instead of ugly GUID-looking thing:

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?responsible=557057%3A7250f3ea-2983-4778-a8cd-e1e2fe1d17ae

This used to work yesterday. A lot of people have these URLs bookmarked and considering it's actually resolves assignee I consider it bug.
fields.summary: 'responsible' URL parameter filter no longer works with username
API v2.0 doesn't return full list of repositories a user can access

fields.description:
There should be an option for a step to be non-critical for it to not block PRs from being merged.

Use case :

When merge checks are set to block PR if any step fails, one step does a network call to npm and fails for some reason, but the step actually is not at all related to the code. It shows the status of the project from npm so cannot be shifted to after-script of a step as the status for the whole pipeline should be {{fail}}. Since this step is wanted to have an automatic trigger so cannot be a custom step.

Whats needed:

* A step which doesn't block PR for being merged when fails
* Shows pipeline status as fail if step failed
* Configurable through bitbucket-pipelines.yml
fields.summary: Optional step for pipeline that never blocks PR to get merge, even when fails
Fails to load a repository Graphs

fields.description:
I am getting constantly the message that "the pull request list was updated" on the PR screen. This is ANNOYING as hell!\\
It doesn't provide any meaningful information: just refresh the screen. Now I have to take an action on the popup which appears every few seconds in the worst case. Not helpful, at all!!
fields.summary: Remove "the pull request list was updated" on PR screen

fields.description:
Regarding the post :

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-Pipelines-questions/Repo-env-var-in-image-line/qaq-p/1046325

I think is would be very good for maintaining multiple projects that use the same hosted image, for the version to set and passed via a repo environment variable.

To me, this makes sense, as you don't always want to use :lastest as after an image has been updated you probably want to manually update those projects you want updating, and leave those you don't as they are.
fields.summary: Allow image version to be passed in image name line

fields.description:
Currently with docker service defined in your pipelines build, occasionally, when calling out the docker command (e.g docker run), it would respond with the following error.

* Error : docker: command not found

*Workaround*\\
As a workaround, re-running the build should resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines : Docker Command Not Found even with docker service defined.

fields.description:
14c0605d06064bcf9a0f9d534dde82e6\\
above is code while pull request.

I try to make pull request from fork repository "sbgocaution"  to main repository, but it give me this error.

In error page there is a message\\
"Something went wrong". I see above code in error page.

Kindly resolve it.
fields.summary: Pull request from Fork repository to Main repository not works.

fields.description: Under the branch view, when we calculate the ahead/behind commit count, we sometimes will not display the ahead/behind count immediately. This task is rather expensive, and requires some asynchronous processing our end to complete. While we eventually will show it, we should display some messaging to wait for the processing to complete.
fields.summary: Improve ahead/behind branch calculation messaging

fields.description:
Using Windows 10, Chrome 73

When using the mouse wheel to open new tabs from the source code browser of a project, if 2 files in different directories have the same name, the new tabs will both show the same file.\\
This does not happen when using the left mouse button to open a file's page. In fact, trying to use the wheel after using the left mouse button will change which file is open in the new tabs, suggesting this may be a caching+js issue.
fields.summary: Mouse Wheel click issue

fields.description: I would like to receive a notification when some properties of my plan is reaching the limit. Is there any way to configure that?
fields.summary: Notification when build minutes are almost consumed

fields.description:
When there are a large number of files changed, using the current view of pull requests (not the new pull request experience), there reaches a point where the following is displayed for contents of each file: "Oops! You've got a lot of code in this diff and it couldn't load with the page". This is fine, but the timeout for loading the content of each file is around a second per file. When there are a lot of files to load then there are a lot of seconds to wait for the page to load. Could this please be improved, e.g. the timeout be reduced or the page load with all contents blank and then the contents load?

IIRC with the new pull request experience, none of the file contents load due to there being too many files.
fields.summary: Quicker rendering of contents of files in pull request with many files

fields.description:
When users browse to www.bitbucket.org they are greeted with the Bitbucket product page. But, when we look closely at the alignment of the Page Title, there is a slight offset with the "Bitbucket Product Logo" and the "Get started" buttons.\\
This seems to be hampering the UI/UX experience of the site for many users.

* Request to please address this and bring about a consistent UI/UX experience :)
fields.summary: Bitbucket Product page - Alignment of UI/UX not consistent

fields.description:
Visual Studio 2017 bitbucket extension not working!\\
hate you and your shit!
fields.summary: Visual Studio bitbucket extension not working

fields.description:
Hi! I'm using Bitbucket well.\\
I created an issue ticket because I thought I needed some improvements.

The code for the Dart language is no syntax highlighting in code editor.\\
But, editing mode, enabled a syntax highlighting.

Attach a screenshot.\\
(Screenshot description : No syntax highlighting for dart languages, in normal mode editor. / Syntax highlighting for dart languages, in edit mode)
fields.summary: Add code syntax highlighting for dart language

fields.description:
Pipelines can currently be only scheduled per hour, day or week, but it would be nice to be able to schedule a pipeline to run on weekdays without having to create 5 separate schedules.

KR\\
Rik
fields.summary: Support weekdays schedule for scheduled pipelines

fields.description:
We are running a number of pipelines at the start and the end of office hours, and it would be nice if those pipelines were run at the requested time locally.

When daylight saving time starts or ends, we always have to shift the schedules 1 hour backward or forward.
fields.summary: Support daylight savings with scheduled builds

fields.description:
The comment and task count on the Dashboard -> Pull requests view uses the older "live" count for task and comments. We should use the same mechanism for all pages to get the counts for consistency.

Right now, we currently get an incorrect ask count when looking at the pull request view after pull request tasks have been resolved.
fields.summary: Incorrect open task count on "Your Work" view

fields.description: If I try to attach a 7z file to an issue or upload it to the downloads section of my repo, I can't anymore - nothing happens when I hit the confirm button on the file picker dialog. I need to upload a zip file instead.
fields.summary: Can't upload 7z archives anymore

fields.description: I want a desktop notification when a deployment succeeds or completes so I can check it out. I don't see any option for something like that: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/notifications-for-bitbucket-pipelines-857053284.html
fields.summary: Pipelines Desktop Notification

fields.description:
Some customers place binaries in the Downloads page of private repos.\\
They would like their clients to access those files even if they (the clients) don't have a Bitbucket account.

At the moment it is only possible to download files from the Downloads page of a repo if you have a Bitbucket account with access to this repo.

Customers would like to be able to use SSH access keys to download from this page (in a similar way that Access keys allow cloning of a repo without the need to have a Bitbucket account).
fields.summary: Allow read-only SSH access to files in the Downloads page of a repo

fields.description:
When a team of developers are commenting on a pull request it would be helpful to approve completed comments or close comments with a will not fix.

This closing/approving would then reduce the number of comments shown on screen. This process pipeline would also allow the {{commentor}} to also filter their notifications around comments that are separately tagged and can then search through the changes and non changes separately when reviewing.

The primary goal for closing these tasks is to make the reviewal process less daunting and cluttered.

This technique is the same as the{{Github}} pull request process.

Is this something in the development pipeline? or is there a better workflow to make addressing a series of comments, on a changing pull request, an easier progress?
fields.summary: Closes/Approving comments

fields.description:
I am trying to deploy a new version through pipeline but I cannot press the deploy button.

It says pipeline is currently running deploying but there's no deployment being sent.
fields.summary: pipeline cannot press deploy button.

fields.description:
Given I have enabled "Require issue keys in commit messages" under "Links" in the repository settings

When I view an issue in the tracker at https://bitbucket.org/[team]/[repo]/issues/[no]/[slug]

Then I would like to see a list of all related commits, perhaps under the Comments section or on a separate screen

Thank you :)
fields.summary: Show list of linked commits against issues in the tracker

fields.description: We are working on VEM project in our account. We are trying to export issues list, we are getting error. I think size could be the problem. Our issues list size is 1.5 GB. Please advise how to download this.
fields.summary: Not able to export issues list

fields.description: This feature request requests the ability to specify the hour and date of a Pipelines run, instead of having a general "Hourly" build or "Weekly", for example.
fields.summary: More granular scheduled Pipelines

fields.description:
If you run a custom build against a branch, there are two pieces of information that are not properly populated:

# The notification sent when the build fails: It states that the build <branch_name> failed even though the build did run a custom Pipeline, not a branch Pipeline
# The trigger of the build on the UI is being set up to a branch Pipeline even though it did run a custom Pipeline.
fields.summary: Wrong information in the notifications and Pipeline UI

fields.description: Bitbucket suggests users that have been removed from the repository when creating pull requets. I would like to have the ability to remove those users from the suggestion.
fields.summary: Ability to remove users from suggested users list for pull requests

fields.description:
I am trying to add a custom Web Panel in the following location:

Web Panel: bitbucket.web.repository.browse.filebrowser.before\\
Context Items: request, principal, repository, atRevisionRef

It works the first time I access to source files view of a branch, but it does not change context when another branch is selected.

I think It should probably refresh this panel as well.
fields.summary: Web Panel do not refresh context when switching a branch

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to create a Scheduled pipelines

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Pipelines tab
# Create a Scheduled pipelines
# Scheduled is created
# Click outside or refresh the page
# Scheduled pipelines are missing

h3. Expected Results
User is able to create a Scheduled pipeline

h3. Actual Results
User is unable to create a Scheduled pipeline
fields.summary: Unable to create Scheduled pipelines

fields.description: How do i remove all alias of another accounts using my email? when I do a commit using my email the name of the commit author appears with another person name
fields.summary: Remove all aliases using my email

fields.description: I only have four members on my team and I am not allowed to take the fifth member.
fields.summary: I can not add more members.

fields.description:
The commit shows up in the JIRA issue page, however the ticket number on bitbucket is not getting linked to the jira page..

This was not a problem until today, I was seeing the link just fine on Friday.
fields.summary: Not able to link Jira ticket number with bitbucket commit

fields.description:
When an author creates a pull request and a colleague updates this request, it is possible for the author to show as both the reviewer and author (on the PR author's dashboard) which is a bit of a strange bug.

Here are the steps to achieve this:

# User A is POST'ing for a new PR with source branch X to Destination Y, adding user B as a reviewer
# Then user C, makes the same pull request POST with source branch X to Destination Y adding user A as a reviewer
# The already created PR gets updated, and instead of a new PR created, or error thrown (as a duplicate) the user A now sees the PR on his Bitbucket dashboard in both sections as a PR to review and _My Pull requests_

(scenario seen in screenshot)

This also changes the behavior on the reviewer's view as well -- they will no longer see "pull requests waiting to review" but will see their view change to see the pull request under _My pull requests_ (even though they are not the author)
fields.summary: Author of pull request showing as reviewer AND author on Bitbucket dashboard

fields.description:
In Atlassian Bitbucket v5.15.0,\\
the color codingcan be wrong when showing the 'diff' in a pull request tab.\\
Integers with single quotes(') are shown like a string is inside the number. (see attached image)
fields.summary: Incorrect markup when using single quotes(') as a separator between digits.

fields.description:
Expected behavior: when opening pipeline schedule I see all scheduled pipelines and can disable them.

Actual behavior: Pipelines are running on schedule, however the schedule does not show any.
fields.summary: Scheduled Pipelines are not displaying while being fired up on schedule

fields.description:
Like Button from pull request comments is not working from some weeks ago.

(In my team workflow, when someone creates a pull request, the other developers review the code and put comments on the PR if there's anything to change or review. When that comment is review, we mark it with a "Like" to let the team know that this comment was already checked).
fields.summary: Pull requests: Like Button on PR comments not working

fields.description:
We need the option to completely hide UI buttons in the repo's sidebar. For example, we should be able to hide:

* Pipelines
* Deployments
* Boards

This has many benefits:

# It allows you to keep the repo clean and simple in case you don't use these features (e.g you use alternatives)
# It keeps your users (e.g. employees) from accidentally enabling/using these features, against company policy.

I can understand Atlassian wanting to promote their features, but things can get cluttered and some people could appreciate the control and simplicity. In my opinion, this is one of the few areas where GitLab still holds the advantage, as it allows you to easily turn UI features on/off.
fields.summary: Allow hiding repository features

fields.description:
I believe that when rendering the following Markdown:

{code}
* Main bullet point
  * Sub-point A
  * Sub-point B
{code}

...that the sub-points should be rendered as indented. However it appears as:

* Main bullet point

** Sub-point A
** Sub-point B

How other services render it:

* On Github 2 spaces are enough to trigger indenting of sub-bullets
* On StackOverflow, a single space is enough
* On BitBucket it seems to require 4 spaces (as the CommonMark standard seems to indicate)

Unfortunately this means that some of our README files appear incorrect and in a confusing manner, where most bullet points are shown at the same level instead of nested.

Since Github flavored markdown (GFM) is very common, is there any chance that BitBucket could render in the same way?
fields.summary: Markdown: Bullets not indented correctly

fields.description:
Example YAML:

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - echo Hello
  custom:
    manual-pipeline:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo Hello
{code}

Normally, when you run a branch pipeline (via a push) and a manual pipeline (on a commit), they will show as two different builds on the Build Status dialog for a specified commit.

However, it is possible to have the manual pipeline override the build status of the branch pipeline. This is caused by triggering the manual pipeline on the Branches Page instead of on an individual commit.

Steps to reproduce:

# Use the YAML specified above.
# Trigger a push pipeline on a specific branch (we'll call this foo-branch).
# This will have also created a new commit on the branch (called abc123)
# Go to the Branches Page, and select the "..." for the 'foo-branch' branch. Select "Run pipeline for a branch" and then "manual-pipeline".
# Go to the commit, and see that the build status still only shows one build, which now links to the newly triggered "manual-pipeline".

Expected behaviour:\\
Both the automatically push triggered branch pipeline and the manually triggered pipeline should show on this commit.

Similar behaviour can also be seen on the Build Status of a Pull Request.
fields.summary: Manual pipeline can override build status of branch pipeline

fields.description: We are unable to browse repositories from the bitbucket web view for private repositories as the attached image. But with the same credentials, I can successfully push the code to the repository via ssh URL but not through https. Please assist to fix this.
fields.summary: Repositories not getting displayed in web view

fields.description:
When I view https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories there are a number of repos that show in the list that have been deleted (either individually, or the owner accounts have been deleted).

As a result...

# I can not leave those repos or remove myself as administrator; and
# I can't filter them out directly

I can work around the issue by filtering to repos I own, but it still seems like a bug that deleted repos can't be removed from the list.

It looks like this happens with repos that were cloned from a repo I was the owner or an admin for at the time; and those permissions were inherited (eg. the various forks of AUI I can see). Which is fine when the repo still exists as I can just go in and remove myself as an admin, or leave the repo. But when the repo is deleted it persists in the list.
fields.summary: Dashboard showing deleted repos

fields.description:
I would like find if the 2 branches in a pull request are out of sync?

i.e. what is the endpoint/property that brings up the blue ribbon which reads "1 commit behind master-v3.3.47. Sync now. "

Also, which endpoint can I use for the sync option?
fields.summary: Out of sync branches in PR

fields.description:
Currently, the Pipes feature does not have support for caching dependencies.
 ([https://bitbucket.org/product/features/pipelines/integrations])

This feature request is requesting the ability to cache Pipes dependencies.
fields.summary: Cache dependencies for Bitbucket Pipes

fields.description: When observing a pull request page, if you select code in once of the changed boxes, the horizontal scroll bar can obscure the last line of code.
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll bar obscures last line of pull requests

fields.description:
Today in Pipelines it's only possible to set up Pipelines one repository at a time.

This feature request is requesting a way to set up a global Pipelines definition that will run in all repositories on the account.
fields.summary: Configure Pipelines on account level

fields.description:
Hi,

I saw from another ticket (see below) that editing a markdown file that's part of your repo now has a preview option.

Can we please also get a preview option before save for editing a markdown file in Bitbucket Snippet editor? This is so I don't have to apply a handful of edits and clutter the snippet revision log with numerous stylistic edits.

Thank you :)

Related ticket:\\
Issue BCLOUD-3491 - Add live-preview when editing Markdown files online (BB-3466)\\
BCLOUD-3491
fields.summary: Add preview of Markdown files online in Snippet editor before saving

fields.description:
This merge is too large to display.

When we create a pull request, tried multiple times. Getting the  same issue.
fields.summary: Error while showing the files (pull request)

fields.description:
When a JIRA issue number is written in the title of a PR, a link is created that is clickable.

When clicked, this link shows the JIRA ticket in a popup. The description of this JIRA ticket is missing in this popup. See attached screenshots.

Are you familiar with this issue?
fields.summary: JIRA ticket description not shown in PR

fields.description: Swervices plugin are not working
fields.summary: Issue in services plugin

fields.description:
Since yesterday afternoon, commits listed on pull requests on the new PR view have had markdown formatting applied to their commit messages, resulting in broken page layouts.

e.g. - If a commit message is prefixed with {{#}} this will be resolved to a h1 tag, breaking the page layout. Please see attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Markdown formatting applied to commit messages

fields.description:
It would be a useful feature to be able to set an expiration date when an admin adds a user into a team. It would also apply for the invitation link which is sent to the user.

There are several companies, who are adding external users into their team and sometimes they forget to remove the external user/group once they don't work with that external group anymore.
fields.summary: Feature to add a user for temporarily period

fields.description:
On a near daily basis, Bitbucket will stop working when trying to do things such as going to a new page, uploading an image in a comment, trying to tag someone in a comment, etc.  It'll usually report something generic such as "something has gone wrong".  If I refresh the page via F5, it redirects me to https://bitbucket.org/socialauth/login/atlassianid/?next=... which appears to log me in or refresh my session, and then I get redirected back to the page I was on, and then everything starts working.

I'm not sure how long Bitbucket sessions last, but it appears the session times out after XX hours even if I'm actively using Bitbucket.  It would be much better if the session automatically was extended which would avoid sessions expiring minutes after interacting with Bitbucket and Bitbucket suddenly stop functioning normally with "something has gone wrong" messages requiring a full page refresh to get a new session and losing unsaved changes.
fields.summary: Bitbucket stops working when session times out despite actively using it

fields.description:
Today in Bitbucket it's necessary to add users group by group, which sometimes can take way too long, as there may be a lot of groups to go through.

This feature requests the ability to have a group where you can add other groups, where once a user is added, it will automatically grant access to every other group inside it.
fields.summary: Nested subgroups for Bitbucket

fields.description: at this state please add this command (&& git pull) to force the user to update his local branch before attempting to solve the conflict
fields.summary: Add (&& git pull) when asking to solve conflicts
Codefresh build status does not appear on the new UI

fields.description: Bug report crash dump in the attachment
fields.summary: Problematic frame: org.bouncycastle.crypto.digests.SHA1Digest.processBlock

fields.description:
First, I can view the whole file down to the last line.\\
Then when I CTRL+F for search I cannot scroll down / see the last lines of the file anymore.

my env:

* Linux
* chrome
* typically using some browser zoom 110%
fields.summary: Source view: Find / search / CTRL-F bar makes last lines of file unreadable

fields.description: When hovering over an avatar of a reviewer of a Pull Request the tooltip says "XYZ updated this pull request just now" even if that specific person did not ever touch this Pull Request.
fields.summary: Misleading tooltip on PR reviewers

fields.description:
We cannot create deployment variables.

Reproduction steps:

* Go to Settings -> Deployment -> Staging
* Set variable name
* Set variable value
* Click add
* Notice how the variable appears for ~1s before disappearing

There is a 404 in the console for GET {{https://api.bitbucket.org/internal/repositories/imperocloud/impero_rs/deployments_config/environments/{<SOME_LONG_HEX_ID>}/variables/?page=1&pagelen=100}}
fields.summary: Cannot create deployment variables

fields.description:
I have found that BitBucket crashes a *lot* lately when I am writing comments on pull requests. The page is completely unresponsive and unrecoverable; I can't reload it, I can't even copy the text I just wrote.\\
There doesn't seem to be anything obvious that triggers it, but possibly related to moving the cursor via keyboard.
fields.summary: PR crashes when writing comments

fields.description: If I visit the Pipelines tab, the Deployments tab or the corresponding settings pages for either add-on, I receive the following message: {{Add-on Pipelines is not responding. Wait or cancel?}}
fields.summary: Pipelines will not load

fields.description:
As per the title, syntax highlighting is broken exclusively when attempting to view a clojure file.\\
This can be seen on the attachment, the syntax highlighting works perfectly fine when editing but when viewing the file the syntax highlighting does not work.
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for .clj (clojure) files does not work correctly when viewing the file

fields.description: The Gmail addon ´Atlassian Extension for Gmail´ is requiring a cloud instance in order to be activated, which shouldn’t be necessary.
fields.summary: Atlassian Extension for Gmail does not work without a Jira instance

fields.description:
When viewing pull requests in Chrome, the _Code Quality_ section populated by SonarCloud analysis is not visible.

Viewing in Safari it shows properly.

The following screenshot of the same pr illustrate this.
fields.summary: Code Quality not visible in Chrome

fields.description:
My use case

* my team member has created a PR and added me as a reviewer there
* I've walked through the PR and put some comments there. There may be strict requirements or just questions amoung them
* some days have passed
* the team member has done some changes, but not all of them
* the team member answered on some of my questions, I've answered back, so we have a number of comment threads

Now I can see a number of comments for each file in Overview tab:

* some of them are effectively resolved (author has done the required change)
* some of them do not require any change (and myself as a reviewer agreed with that)
* some of them still require some changes

I'd like to and see if there're any unresolved comment threads in Overview tab, so that I can mark threads of case BCLOUD-1 and BCLOUD-2 as resolved and see only unresolved threads.
fields.summary: As a Pull Request reviewer I'd like to mark comments thread as resolved so that I can see if there're any unresolved threads before I approve the PR

fields.description: While Testing, VPN is disconnecting very often.
fields.summary: VPN issue- VPN connection is not stable

fields.description: I have run BFG on my repo cybercubeio/cybercube-frontend to reduce file size and pushed to bitbucket. Can you run aggressive gc on my remote to reduce size of remote repo?
fields.summary: gc: remote

fields.description:
After transferring a repository from one workspace to another, the Variables (repository variables and Deployment variables) disappear.
Activating Pipelines in the repository after the transfer recovers the repository variables but, not the Deployment variables.

We expect that, as it happens to the repository variables, that the Deployment variables get transferred with the repository that these were linked to before the transfer process.

h3. Workaround:

Transferring the repository back will cause the repository to retrieve its Deployment variables.
Doing so, it is possible to take note of the not private Deployment variables and, again, transfer the repository and set up the variables with the retrieved information.
fields.summary: Ability to transfer Pipelines variables when transferring the repository to a diff account

fields.description:
We have many repositories sharing the same pipeline Account level Environment Variables.

We have 20 secure username and password pairs per environment and growing.   So in total approx. 160 entries within the account level environment variables.

Similar to issue BCLOUD-17056 which suggests the ability to group variables on the UI we would like:

# The variables listed in alphabetical order.
# The ability to search for a variable.

Using browser search does not work for us as not all 160 entries are loaded on the screen (one has to scroll to the bottom and 'load more...' first).
fields.summary: Search and Sort Account Environment Variables

fields.description: BitBucket & JIRA need to collaborate more.  We have end users who are using BitBucket and not JIRA.  Why can't they submit an issue in BitBucket (a platform they are familiar with) and have that create a bug issue type for the project team to prioritize in JIRA?
fields.summary: Enable BitBucket to Create JIRA Issue Type "Bug" in Jira

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

* Go to Bitbucket Labs >> Disable "New pull request experience BETA".
* Access an old PR with Reviewers.
* Leave the cursor under a Reviewer Avatar.
* That will show up as "User updated this Pull Request right now", even that the user hasn't taken any recent action on that PR.
fields.summary: Reviewers updates are not showing up correctly in the old UI

fields.description: I am unable to view a Pull Request that has a large number of changes/files in it.  (e.g. we have over 1,300 files in the PR; it's the first PR from develop into master for the project).  On loading, I just get "That page timed out while trying to load" in a BitBucket page (not a Chrome page).
fields.summary: That page timed out while trying to load

fields.description:
As a Bitbucket user, I'd like to be able create PRs from a simple URL combination I type in a browser, a la docs.new.

https://twitter.com/TechWriterNinja/status/1111788906872082432
fields.summary: Create PRs from a simple URL combination I type in a browser similar to docs.new

fields.description:
Today in Pipelines it's not possible to specify a string that Pipelines will look for to skip (or run) a build on any circumstance, and this is what this feature request is asking for.

Not to be confused with the [skip ci] flag, this feature request is asking for the ability to specify on the Pipelines YML which commits should not run a build, by specifying its commit message on the YML.
fields.summary: Specify commits comments that should automatically skip ci

fields.description:
When JIRA DVCS connector is performing a long synchronisation from Bitbucket Cloud, memcache from Bitbucket side is expiring. Bitbucket returns error 500 to Jira.

Steps to Reproduce

# In JIRA Software, link Bitbucket Cloud under the DVCS account configuration
# JIRA will then start adding the corresponding repository
# Under certain circumstances, sometimes JIRA fails to perform the synchronisation and Bitbucket Cloud returns error 500

Expected Results: Bitbucket doesn't return error 500

Actual Results:\\
JIRA DVCS connector is not aware of the memcache expiring and failed to re-establish a reconnection. During this event, Bitbucket returns error 500.

Corresponding Jira bug ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67936
fields.summary: Bitbucket returns error 500 to JIRA DVCS due to expired memcache on Bitbucket Cloud
